column1: 216*{'text': 'The Baths of Caracalla in Rome are completed with public baths (Thermae)
column5: and public gardens that cover 20 acres.'

column1: 216*{'text': 'Emperor Caracalla tricks the Parthians by accepting a marriage proposal.'

column3: established himself as king of the Kingdom of Wei.'

column1: 216*{'text': 'Mithraism
column3: is on course to be adopted by many Roman soldiers serving in Asia.'

column1: 217*{'text': 'Macrinus
column3: becomes the first equestrian Roman emperor.'

column1: 217*{'text': 'The Colosseum is badly damaged by fire (lightning) which destroys the wooden upper levels of the amphitheater.'

217*{'text': 'Ciriacus succeeds Philadelphus as Patriarch of Constantinople.'

212*{'text': 'The edict of emperor Caracalla (Constitutio Antoniniana) extends Roman citizenship to all free inhabitants of the Roman Empire with the exception of a limited group that may include Egyptians.'

213*{'text': 'Cao Cao

column3: is titled Wei Gong (Duke of Wei) and given a fief of ten cities under his domain.'

column1: 211*{'text': 'Emperor Septimius Severus falls ill and dies in Britain after an 18-year reign.'

column2: 'text': 'Geta is lured to come without his bodyguards to meet Caracalla

column1: 219*{'text': 'The reign of Pulona

column4: while Lü Meng of Eastern Wu captures his home base.'

column2: he sees no way out and hangs himself.'

column1: 280*{'text': 'Julius Saturninus
column3: is in Alexandria charged with the defense of the East.'

column1: 280*{'text': 'The Thuringii
column3: appears in the Harz Mountains (Thuringia) of central Germania.'

column2: he founds the Western Jin Dynasty.'

column1: 280*{'text': 'The Gupta Empire (India) is founded (approximate date).'

283*{'text': 'Emperor Carus travels through Thrace and Asia Minor

283*{'text': 'Carus dies in mysterious circumstances during an expedition against the Sassanids
column2: during a violent dust storm he is killed by a stroke of lightning.'

column1: 283*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius Carinus succeeds his father Carus.'

column1: 282*{'text': 'Emperor Probus travels towards Sirmium (Serbia).'

column2: for his victories he is given the title Germanicus Maximus.'

column1: 282*{'text': 'Carus appoints his oldest son Marcus Aurelius Carinus
column2: Caesar and co-emperor of the western Roman Empire.'

column1: 282*{'text': 'A new city is constructed in Fuzhou slightly south of the original city Ye (the main street of the city has remained unchanged since that time).'

column1: 284*{'text': 'The Bagaudae
column3: revolt in Gaul against the Roman Empire.'

column1: 284*{'text': 'Sabinus Julianus

column1: 262*{'text': 'The Goths invade Asia Minor and destroy the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus.'

column2: which led to the persecution of the Christians.'

column1: 261*{'text': 'Michu ascends the Silla throne
column2: becoming the first king of the long Kim line.'

column1: 260*{'text': 'Valerianus I arranges a meeting with Shapur to negotiate a peace settlement.'

column1: 260*{'text': 'Gallienus evacuates the fortifications (limes) in the Agri Decumates (Germania Superior)
column2: covering the Black Forest area in the face of invading Alamanni.'

column1: 260*{'text': 'Gallienus established himself at Mediolanum (modern Milan)
column2: he reorganizes the army supported by elite cavalry and dispatch troops to the Rhine frontier.'

column1: 260*{'text': 'Postumus
column3: forms the Gallic Empire and protects the Rhine against an invasion of Germanic tribes.'

column1: 260*{'text': 'Saloninus
column3: is proclaimed Augustus by his troops.'

260*{'text': 'Postumus wins over all the Roman provinces west of the Alps

260*{'text': 'Syria
column2: Egypt and Palestine break off from the Roman Empire to form the Persian-supported Palmyrene Empire.'

column1: 260*{'text': 'Earliest known date of chess.'
260*{'text': 'Pope Dionysius convenes a synod at Rome to demand an explanation from bishop Dionysius of Alexandria
column2: who has been charged with separating the members of the Trinity as three distinct deities.'

column1: 260*{'text': 'Paul of Samosata becomes Patriarch of Antioch.'

column2: they unsuccessfully attack Byzantium and Cyzicus.'

column1: 267*{'text': 'The Goths sack several cities of southern Greece including Athens

column4: is proclaimed emperor by his troops
column5: and begins his march on Rome.'

column1: 266*{'text': 'The rule of High King Cormac mac Airt ends (approximate date).'

268*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius Claudius is charged by the Senate for having murdered Gallienus (it will never be proven).'

268*{'text': 'The Alamanni invade Italy north of the Po River.'
268*{'text': 'The Visigoths first appear as a distinct people.'

column1: 298*{'date': 'March 10'

column1: 298*{'text': 'The Baths of Diocletian are commissioned by Maximian in honor of Emperor Diocletian.'
298*{'text': 'Galerius invades Armenia with an army of 25

294*{'text': 'Galerius
column3: proves his worth in campaigning on the Danube frontier

column2: moving the entire tribe of the Carpi to settlements within the Roman Empire.'

column3: is dispatched to Egypt to fight against the rebellious cities Busiris and Coptos.'

column1: 295*{'text': 'Tuoba Luguan divides the territory of the Tuoba clan into three areas.'

column1: 292*{'text': 'Achilleus

290*{'text': 'Carausius who has established himself as king of Britain
column2: is also reluctantly acknowledged by Diocletian and Maximian as third emperor.'

column3: founder of the Western Jin Dynasty

column1: 291*{'text': 'Emperor Diocletian signs peace treaties with the kingdoms of Aksum and Nubia.'

column1: 270*{'text': 'Aurelianus pushes the Goths back across the Danube and recovers Roman territory.'

column1: 271*{'text': 'Victorinus
column4: reportedly for reasons of personal revenge.'

column2: and breaks all relations with the Roman Empire.'

column3: and two of his disciples are beheaded on the road to the Temple of Mercury that stands atop a hill outside of the city.'

273*{'text': 'Marcus Claudius Tacitus

273*{'text': 'Cassius Longinus
column3: is executed by the Romans for conspiring against Aurelian.'

column1: 273*{'text': 'An Indian delegation visits Aurelian.'

column2: which is graced by his captives Tetricus I and his son Tetricus II.'

column1: 274*{'text': 'Germanic tribes take advantage of the destroyed Roman forces of the Rhine.'

column2: 'text': 'Pope Felix I dies in Rome after a 5-year reign.'

column1: 275*{'text': 'Emperor Aurelian prepares a campaign against the Sassanids in Asia Minor.'

column1: 275*{'text': 'Gaul is pillaged by the Franks and the Alemanni.'

column2: 'text': 'Pope Eutychian succeeds Pope Felix I as the 27th pope.'

column3: Spain and Italy to fight a indecisive battle with Marcus Aurelius Probus in Cilicia.'

column1: 276*{'text': 'Florianus holds power for some weeks
column2: but is assassinated by his own troops near Tarsus (Turkey).'

column1: 276*{'text': 'Probus appoints Marcus Aurelius Carus to Prefect of the Praetorian Guard
column2: he returns the aurelianianus to the standard and official tariffing of Aurelian.'

column1: 276*{'text': 'Reign of Mahasena in Ceylon.'

column3: dies at Gundeshapur after 30 years of preaching his "heresy" at the court of the late Sassanian king Shapur I and on long journeys to Khorasan

column1: 277*{'text': 'Probus enters Rome to have his position as Emperor ratified by the Senate.'

278*{'text': 'Emperor Probus defeats the Alamanni

column2: an Indian handbook on the art of sexual love
column3: is probably produced around this time by the sage Vatsyayana.'

column1: 300*{'text': 'The elephant becomes extinct in North Africa (approximate date).'

column1: 300*{'text': 'The magnetic compass for navigation is invented in China (approximate date).'

column2: a Sanskrit collection of fables and fairy tales

column1: 258*{'text': 'The amount of silver in the Roman currency

column1: 253*{'text': 'Aemilianus is murdered at Spoletium and Publius Valerianus
column3: is recognised as new emperor by the Rhine legions.'
